text: [Music]
as an officer in the in the Infantry I
planned and executed missions to lead
security operations in Iraq and
Afghanistan coming from the military I
thought I was a leader I knew what it
was to be a leader I didn't think I'd
learn that much about leadership at HBS
but it has really taught me a lot about
being a leader as a leader in the Army
you're definitely expected to be
decisive make decisions on your own
without too much guidance necessarily
but Harvard Business School has really
driven me towards finding a lot more
diversity of perspective before I make
decisions and so I think that's really
going to make me a better leader and
that's not something I expected before
coming to HPS you get some very honest
feedback because everyone's just
speaking their mind and that's the type
of structure that you want probably in
any organization very honest open
communication and feedback I don't think
every leader can get that and that's
something I'll definitely seek you want
something that models that very open
discussion where it's sort of No Holds
bar everyone can talk to each other as a
peer that's something I'll try to model
in organizations that I go to in the
[Music]
future
